title: Compiler panics when missing parenthesis around tuple when pushing onto Vec

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I was converting a list from a tuple of Vec's to a Vec of tuples, and missed a spot. ### Code ```Rust type SnrFifoList = Vec<( u64, u32, u32, u32, u32, u32 )>; pub struct LoopStats { num_good_tbs : u64, num_bad_tbs : u64, received_tbs : u64, sot : u32, sot_mismatch : u64, status : [u64; NUM_STATS], snr_list : SnrFifoList, // tbcount + five words per fifo entry } ... 299 loop_stats.snr_list.push( 300 loop_stats.received_tbs, 301 snr_fifo[0], 302 snr_fifo[1], 303 snr_fifo[2], 304 snr_fifo[3], 305 snr_fifo[4], 306 ); .... the fix was to add parenthesis around the tuple in line 299 and 306 299 loop_stats.snr_list.push(( 300 loop_stats.received_tbs, 301 snr_fifo[0], 302 snr_fifo[1], 303 snr_fifo[2], 304 snr_fifo[3], 305 snr_fifo[4], 306 )); col 29 ------------------------^ col 37--------------------------------^ ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.60.0-nightly (498eeb72f 2022-01-31) binary: rustc commit-hash: 498eeb72f590e518e19746b346be53713689e207 commit-date: 2022-01-31 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling avalon v0.5.0 (/home/sscttna/projects/avalon) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_typeck/src/check/fn_ctxt/_impl.rs:318:26: while adjusting Expr { hir_id: HirId { owner: DefId(0:28842 ~ avalon[de92]::ct::rx::continuous_rx), local_id: 1145 }, kind: Path(Resolved(None, Path { span: src/ct/rx.rs:301:29: 301:37 (#0), res: Local(HirId { owner: DefId(0:28842 ~ avalon[de92]::ct::rx::continuous_rx), local_id: 441 }), segments: [PathSegment { ident: snr_fifo#0, hir_id: Some(HirId { owner: DefId(0:28842 ~ avalon[de92]::ct::rx::continuous_rx), local_id: 1144 }), res: Some(Local(HirId { owner: DefId(0:28842 ~ avalon[de92]::ct::rx::continuous_rx), local_id: 441 })), args: None, infer_args: true }] })), span: src/ct/rx.rs:301:29: 301:37 (#0) }, can't compose [Borrow(Ref('_#345r, Not)) -> &[u32; 5]] and [Borrow(Ref('_#350r, Not)) -> &[u32; 5]] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1157:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0-nightly (498eeb72f 2022-01-31) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C linker=aarch64-none-linux-gnu-gcc --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `ct::rx::continuous_rx` #1 [typeck] type-checking `ct::rx::continuous_rx::{closure#0}` end of query stack error: could not compile `avalon` ```
Backtrace
